Two things I disagree with in your post:
First: You're posting this in an Announcement thread. The appropriate place is, I believe, Gameplay Questions and Tutorials. But that's nitpicking.

Second: I posit that your suggestion to create engines which would make it "SO EASY" to create SSTO's would be poorly received. From my narrow perspective, SSTO's should feel like the engineering feat they are. The R.A.P.I.E.R.s make SSTO's easy enough as it is. Additionally, we do possess LF-only engines: the LV-N. It is perfectly viable to use an LV-N and some turbojets or R.A.P.I.E.R.s to achieve orbit on exclusively LF.

One thing I agree with in your post:
More, bigger parts. I want this. Bigger boosters is always good. They allow crazy-overbuilt lifters with next to no parts, as well as vessels and stations with massive fuel reserves and a similar dearth of parts. These are good things.

However, these are easily addressed by mods. If you want easy SSTO's, check out:
Orbit Portal Technologies (OPT) by K.Yeon, maintained by stali79. It's currently in a state of vigorous pushing for compatibility, but it's coming along.
Mark IV Spaceplanes by Nertea. Extra-large lifting-body cross-section with large, open cargo bays. Said cargo bays open in a variety of ways.
B9 Aerospace by Bac9, Blowfish, et al. Large variety of cross-sections, engines, et cetera, from small to large to bloody massive (HX-series).
